=Getting started as a developer=

# Prerequisites:
  * install Java SDK 1.6+
  * install apache maven
  * install svn client


http://code.google.com/p/gbif-providertoolkit/source/browse/#svn/trunk/motherpom

# Get the code

- create a project folder

- in a terminal:
  * cd into the project folder
  * $ svn checkout http://gbif-providertoolkit.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/motherpom motherpom
  * $ svn checkout http://gbif-providertoolkit.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/gbif-providertool gbif-providertool

# build the projects
  * cd motherpom/
  * mvn install
  * cd gbif-providertool/

# the following will take a LONG time the first execution (grab a coffee / lunch)

  * mvn install -Dmaven.test.skip=true

# HINT: if you know you have all the libraries on the machine (e.g. after the first build), use the following:

  * mvn install -o -npu

# this will start a Jetty Server running the application

  * mvn jetty:run-war -Dmaven.test.skip=true

# set up eclipse

  * mvn eclipse:eclipse

# some environments have issues with the above

  * mvn org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-eclipse-plugin:2.6:eclipse

# open eclipse and do an "import existing project into the workspace" 

# select the project folder as the root and it should show the gbif-providertool
